alert.note: Alert for Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Frank Church Wilderness; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region; Wood River Foothills (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 3:03AM MST until December 02 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING FOR NEXT APPROACHING STORM... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches, except 15 to 25 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Locally higher amounts to 3 feet near the peaks and ridges of the Sawtooth Mountains and West Smokys. While light snow will start Wednesday morning, the heaviest snow is expected to start late Wednesday night. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph resulting in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...The Sawtooths, Smoky Mountains, Pioneer Mountains, White Knob Mountains, White Clouds, Boulders, Wood River Foothills, Stanley Basin, Frank Church Wilderness, Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin, and Sun Valley region, including but not limited to Banner Summit, Stanley, Galena Summit, Ketchum, Hailey, Bellevue, Picabo, and Clayton. * WHEN...From late Wednesday morning through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially during the Thursday morning and Thursday evening commutes. Wind gusts in excess of 30 MPH near mountain highway passes as well as peaks and ridgelines may also result in areas of blowing and drifting snow and dangerous conditions in the backcountry.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Frank Church Wilderness; Sawtooth, Stanley Basin; Sun Valley Region; Wood River Foothills
